org.exist.debugger.model
Interface Breakpoint

public interface Breakpoint

Author:
Dmitriy Shabanov

Field Summary
static String TYPE_CALL
          break on entry into new stack for function name
static String TYPE_CONDITIONAL
          break when the given expression is true at the given filename and line number or just in given filename
static String TYPE_EXCEPTION
          break on exception of the given name
static String TYPE_LINE
          break on the given lineno in the given file
static String TYPE_RETURN
          break on exit from stack for function name
static String TYPE_WATCH
          break on write of the variable or address defined by the expression argument

Method Detail

getType

String getType()

setType

void setType(String type)

getFilename

String getFilename()
The file the breakpoint is effective in. This must be a "file://" or "dbgp:" (See 6.7 Dynamic code and virtual files) URI.

Returns:
the source URI

getLineno

Integer getLineno()
Line number on which breakpoint is effective. Line numbers are 1-based. If an implementation requires a numeric value to indicate that lineno is not set, it is suggested that -1 be used, although this is not enforced.

Returns:
line number

setLineno

void setLineno(Integer lineno)

getState

boolean getState()
Current state of the breakpoint. This must be one of enabled, disabled.

Returns:
current state: true = enabled, false = disabled

setState

void setState(boolean state)

getFunction

String getFunction()
Function name for call or return type breakpoints.

Returns:
function name

setFunction

void setFunction(String function)

getTemporary

boolean getTemporary()
Flag to define if breakpoint is temporary. A temporary breakpoint is one that is deleted after its first use. This is useful for features like "Run to Cursor". Once the debugger engine uses a temporary breakpoint, it should automatically remove the breakpoint from it's list of valid breakpoints.

Returns:
true if it's temporary

setTemporary

void setTemporary(boolean temporary)

getHitCount

int getHitCount()
Number of effective hits for the breakpoint in the current session. This value is maintained by the debugger engine (a.k.a. DBGP client). A breakpoint's hit count should be increment whenever it is considered to break execution (i.e. whenever debugging comes to this line). If the breakpoint is disabled then the hit count should NOT be incremented.

Returns:
number of effective hits

setHitCount

void setHitCount(int count)

getHitValue

int getHitValue()
A numeric value used together with the hit_condition to determine if the breakpoint should pause execution or be skipped.

Returns:
numeric of hit to pause execution

setHitValue

void setHitValue(int value)

getHitCondition

String getHitCondition()
A string indicating a condition to use to compare hit_count and hit_value. The following values are legal: >= break if hit_count is greater than or equal to hit_value [default] == break if hit_count is equal to hit_value % break if hit_count is a multiple of hit_value

Returns:
hit condition string

setHitCondition

void setHitCondition(String condition)

getException

String getException()
Exception name for exception type breakpoints.

Returns:
exception name

setException

void setException(String exception)

getId

int getId()

setId

void setId(int breakpointNo)

toXMLString

String toXMLString()

sync

boolean sync()
             throws IOException
Throws:
IOException

remove

boolean remove()
               throws IOException
Throws:
IOException
